newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends up on Japan, CBOT, lack of hedges.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends up on Japan, CBOT, lack of hedges.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended up on higher CBOT soycomplex values and Japanese demand, traders said.

"There was Japanese buying at the close, there's not many hedges and Chicago's up," a trader said. May WCE crush profit margin rose to -10.42 Monday from -12.35 Friday. Road bans and heavy snow blocked farmer deliveries while only half of WCE traders were able to reach downtown after the weekend's record-breaking blizzard. Sep-Nov spread at $5, July-Nov $56, May-July $3.50. Volume was 6,659 lots with 534 hedge lots.
Japan bought 3,000-5,000 tonnes overnight, sources said.
May rose $4.40 to $424.90, July rose $5.60 to $429.20.
May flax rose $2 to $356, July up $1 to $351.50 as PCTS bought 150 May-July at $4, Nov rose $0.90 to $324.50 on commercial demand.
May western barley rose $2.20 to $140.90 as commercials bought from Alberta Wheat Pool and Midland Walwyn. Seventy five May-July spread at $1. Volume was 350 lots.
May feed wheat rose $3.30 to $169.50 as UGG sold to commercials and commission houses. Volume was 170 lots.
UGG sold 15 May feed pea contracts up US$2 to US$215. Oats did not trade.
(All values in Canadian dollars, except feed peas)
